name: Pool (Bug-Byte Software)
overview: This is a very simple pool simulation for one or two players. The playing screen consists of a red cue ball and 6 numbered red balls on a green background. In the top left of the screen is a blue power bar that cycles through 1 to 5 levels. The player uses the arrow keys to position a cursor, then presses S to shoot. If you don't pot anything after about half a dozen shots, then the game resets. There's no clever physics behind this game, balls don't seem to slow down as they move across the table, they move at a steady pace until they stop. The points scored for each ball potted are calculated as 10 * the ball's number
